resources.string: This flow type has no stages configured
Timeout while waiting for a response from a flow application in seconds.\nMin: 0 Max: 3600. Use 0 to set no timeout.
Timeout while waiting for a response from a payment application in seconds.\nMin: 0 Max: 3600. Use 0 to set no timeout.
Timeout while waiting for a response from the split application in seconds.\nMin: 0 Max: 3600. Use 0 to set no timeout.
Timeout while waiting for a response from an application during a status update in seconds.\nMin: 0 Max: 3600. Use 0 to set no timeout.
Timeout while waiting for a response from the user to select an application or device in seconds.\nMin: 0 Max: 3600. Use 0 to set no timeout.
If set, this will abort (CANCEL) a payment if any flow application in the flow fails with an error.

If set, this ensures that the flow will be aborted (CANCELLED) if an error occurs during a call to ANY payment application. If disabled the flow will keep attempting to take payment until manually cancelled.
If set, this will allow access to FPS from the status bar.
If set, this will enable support for legacy payment apps (AEVI Public SDK - Simple Payment API v2).
If set, all AppFlow IPC will be performed over a websocket instead of the default Android Messenger
Warning: The features below are currently in development and not guaranteed to work. Use with caution.
Date format to use for displaying dates within AppFlow
Time format to use for displaying time within AppFlow
If set, FPS will filter flow services based on what flow types they report they support for the given flow.
If set, FPS will allow external devices to connect and be used for application execution as part of a flow. This feature is currently not available.
If set, FPS will always execute the PRE_FLOW stage, as opposed to only executing it for zero-based payment requests.
The maximum number of request history database rows allowed in FPS.
If set, flow services are allowed to change the currency of a flow (dynamic currency conversion). This feature is currently not available.
